Description: Mapping and charts for a wide variety of national data sets (including borders, demographics, transit, food & drink, recreation, schools, lending, amenities, vacancies, etc.)
Mapping and charts for a wide variety of national data sets (demographics, housing, lending, quality of life, economy, etc.). Some features require a subscription.

Provides measures of relative opportunity across all census tracts in a metropolitan area using a variety of data sources. The data is presented as z-scores for various indicators. It is a collaboration between the diversitydatakids.org project and the Kirwan Institute for the Study of Race and Ethnicity.
Demographic characteristics of people and households, occupancy and tenure of housing units.
Sample survey with demographic, economic, and housing characteristics of people, households, and housing units.

Data set/Resource: Affirmatively Furthering Fair Housing Data Collection
Description: This set of data contains indicators related to opportunity collected from a variety of datasets. Also has a mapping tool.

Home mortgage applications, loans, and loan denial rates by applicants' income, and race/ethnicity. Includes information on high interest rate lending. Updates in September. Request older data through National Archives. Data files for download.

Numbers of households and housing needs indicators (e.g., housing cost burdens) by HUD income category (e.g., less than 30 percent of area median income, 30-50 percent of area median, etc.). Map tool option available.
A variety of project-level data on Low-Income Housing Tax Credit projects including low-income units, project type (new construction/rehabilitation), and number of bedrooms.
Information on FHA loans which became 90 days delinquent during their first two years, by geographic area or originating lender.
Project and tract-level data on housing units (total and by bedroom size) covered by Section 8 contracts and expiration year for those contracts. Some entries from before 2001.
Characteristics and counts of the households in public and subsidized housing units

Data sets on single-family and multifamily mortgage purchases by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.  Includes information on the income, race, and gender of borrower as well as the loan-to-value ratios, purchase/ refinancing, and affordability.
Number of addresses receiving mail and the number not receiving mail by length of vacancy.

Estimates of the percentage of a family's income dedicated to the combined cost of housing and transportation in a given location for different types of households. Also includes the independent variables that were used to construct the index.
Integrates information on all housing subsidies for each federally subsidized project

This interactive mapping tool shows HUD investments (grants, rental assistance, counseling, etc.) by city, state, county, metropolitan area, or congressional district. It shows property- and grant-level detail at a variety of geographies and has a downloading feature.

Interactive mapping tool allows selection by various geographies (block group up to states) and to color areas by demographics and then select them to see eviction rates. Offers charts and comparisons. Data available for download via sign up.
Data on filers' income and age distribution, savings information, EITC and RAL, tax providers.

Data set/Resource: Brookings Institution Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) Interactive
Description: All data are derived from the IRS Stakeholder Partnerships, Education, and Communication (SPEC) Return Information Databases. It contains various income and tax variables from individual tax returns summarized for EITC-claimants and all taxpayers.

Summary data on numbers of private business establishments and employment by number of employees and type of industry (e.g., manufacturing, trade). Also includes establishments in retail service categories such as grocery stores, banks, and dry cleaners.

Data set/Resource: Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance (OASDI) beneficiaries
Description: Includes the number and type of beneficiaries (retired, disabled, surviving family members), the amount of benefits paid, and the number of beneficiaries over age 65.

Data set/Resource: Small Area Income and Poverty Estimates
Description: Number of people in poverty by age group and the median household income. Has downloadable data and interactives tools (including a map).
Data on the number and characteristics of workers by location of residence and location of workplace, and commuter flows from block to block.
Includes description of schools and school districts, including name, address; data on students and staff, including demographics.
column7: second link goes to law firm, doesn't seem right?

Description: Includes data for every public school disaggregated by race/ethnicity, English learner status, sex, and disability. Measures student access to advanced and AP courses, SAT/ACT tests, gifted and IB programs, preschool programs, and interscholastic athletics. Also tracks teacher and resource equity; and reveals school climate disparities. Available as download or through data tool.
Includes locations of full-service and limited service bank branches.
Descriptive information from charities' initial registration with financial variables from the Tax Form 990. Only for nonprofits required to file taxes ($25,000 revenue and above).

Data set/Resource: Public Libraries in the US Survey
Description: The Public Library Survey (PLS) provides national descriptive data on the status of public libraries in the United States & its territories. Data are collected from over 9,000 public library systems with over 17,000 public library outlets

Years available in electronic format: 2018 (living file; fixed files from 2014 and 2015 available)
Description: Contains basic identifying information of about 35,000  museums in the United States.  Data is aggregated from a variety of sources including the Institute for Museum and Library Studies, Internal Revenue Service (IRS), private foundations, and commercial vendors.

A collection of indicators from various sources that help to measure location efficiency. It includes indicators related to housing density, diversity of land use, neighborhood design, destination accessibility, transit service, employment, and demographics. Can use interactive map tool or download data.

Data set/Resource: EPA Enforcement and Compliance History Online (ECHO)
Description: A collection of many individual EPA data sources information on regulated facilities related to air emissions, surface water discharges, hazardous waste, and drinking water systems. Contains permit data, inspection dates and findings, violations, enforcement actions, and penalties assessed. Map tool and data download option.
Information about hazardous waste sites, facilities that produce and release air pollutants or toxics, and permits to discharge to water.
12 different environmental factors, demographic indicators, and a composite environmental justice index

Data set/Resource: Community-Focused Exposure and Risk Screening Tool (C-FERST)
Description: Data on environmental concentrations (lead, formaldehyde, etc.), estimated exposures and risks (cancer), pollution, and community information. Available in map and exportable table form.

Smallest geography: 1º x 1º Latitude-Longitude Grid, Individual Weather Station Data
Description: Data on the average, high, and low temperature over land; over land and oceans (NetCDF format).
Model-based small area estimates for 27 measures of chronic disease related to unhealthy behaviors (5), health outcomes (13), and use of preventive services (9) for the 500 most populous cities
Indicators related to low income status and level of access to supermarkets, as measured by the different distance demarcations.

Data set/Resource: United States Small-Area Life Expectancy Estimates Project
Description: A five-year estimate for life expectancy at birth of each census tract, downloadable by state or entire country.

Frequency of source data update: Varies depending on data (usually at least once per year)
Description: Map and data shows reach of federal Health Center Programs (e.g. can overlay service area points with census tracts). You must register for free to access the mapping tool and can then download whatever data you input into maps and tables.

Data set/Resource: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program Retailer Locator
Description: A list of the store name and address of food retailers accepting Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program for payment
